name: Agua De Annique - Air 2LP
description: First release by Agua De Annique on Vinyl! A rarity by now. Still available for a fair price in our little shop.

name: Klimt 1918 - Just In Case We'll Never Meet Again LP
description:
With their third album Klimt 1918 created an exceptional album that is full of joy, sadness, beauty, melancholy and dreams. A fantastic blend of emo/alternative rock with influences from 80's gothic pop/darkwave, post-rock and shoegaze. The Cure meets Alcest here.

The LP comes in a retro-look with heavy, UV-lacquered 350g jacket and printed inner sleeves. 1st press (!) limited to 250 handnumbered copies on blood red vinyl.

name: Leech - The Stolen View 2LP / If We Get There... 2LP
description: After hearing Leech's 'Stolen View' on CD in 2008 we were very impressed by this instrumental post-rock / metal band. Months and months this was announced as a "soon-to-be-expected-on-vinyl" release on their label, but it never saw the light of day. We were a little disappointed that it was scrapped from the release schedule, until... we found out that the band released it themselves a few years ago on a limited scale! We got hold of a handful of copies :-) Definitely not available at your average mailorder! Also available from us: 'If We Get There One Day, Would You Please Open The Gates?' on 4 different Vinyl colors.

options.name: If We Get There - Amber Vinyl
If We Get There - Blue Vinyl
If We Get There - White Vinyl
If We Get There - Clear Vinyl

name: Our Ceasing Voice - When The Headline Hit Home 2LP
description:
Austrian post-rock highlight! Based on the upcoming novel by Sebastian Obermeir, Our Ceasing Voice's new 2011 album pursues the concept established with their 2009 EP Steadied Stars In The Morphium Sky, while the development to a darker, more dynamic sound is clearly noticeable. Beautiful and saddening at the same time, the Austrians draw attention to fragility, passionately making one's flesh creep and thereby portraying a dramatic story full of yearning and desperation. Essential listening!

Released on 2 x 180 gram vinyl in a high quality gatefold sleeve with inlay and huge poster!

name: Three Steps To The Ocean 12"
description: Very good, underrated post-rock from Italy. We've been carrying this 12" since 2007 and NO-ONE is buying it, even at the ridiculously low price it has always been offered for. Doesn't sound like a good selling argument, does it? Well, we hope you'll go check it out somewhere online now and check back here later to get it on vinyl!
